definition: to sinicize/to take on Chinese characteristics
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: The process of Marxism Sinicization is the continuous process of emancipating the mind.
sentences.chinese: 馬克思主義中國化的進程，就是不斷解放思想的進程。

sentences.english: The sinicization of Marxism is an important subject concerns the future and the destiny of the Communist Party of China.
sentences.chinese: 馬克思主義中國化是關係黨的前途和命運的重大課題。

sentences.english: But there are a few exceptions to my “being Chinese.”
sentences.chinese: 但“我的中國化”也有一些例外。

sentences.english: And unlike Westernization, it is an internalizing process.
sentences.chinese: 與西化不同，中國化是一種內化的過程。

sentences.english: Chapter IV discussed the story with the Goddess of Mercy Kuan Yin Ling-Ying Chinese relations.
sentences.chinese: 第四章討論觀音靈應故事與觀音中國化的關係。

sentences.english: Tiantai sect is a Buddhism sect of Chinese style.
sentences.chinese: 天台宗是中國化的佛教宗派。

sentences.english: This thesis first analyses the intension and necessity of the sinicization of Marxism.
sentences.chinese: 本文首先分析了馬克思主義中國化的內涵及其必要性。

sentences.english: There is a strong argument that China is becoming more Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 有強大的論點說中國正在更中國化。

sentences.english: These days, I am more Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 現在，我變得越來越中國化。
在中國，就是“馬克思主義中國化”。

sentences.english: The Yenan rectification and the sinicization of Marxism have close relationship.
sentences.chinese: 延安整風與馬克思主義中國化有着密切的關係。

sentences.english: The period of May-4th Movement is the historical starting point of Marxist Sinicization.
sentences.chinese: 五四運動時期是馬克思主義中國化的歷史起點。

definition: to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
